div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 2334 Valeria (= Valera de Arriba), 30 km. S of Cuenca, 1948 Burial: c. 200 B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: 39 AR. With fragments of silver jewelry and plate Hispano-Punic: 4 didr., 1 dr., 1 fr. Emporiae: 1 dr. Ebusus: 1 triob. Iberian: 12 dr. (9 Emporitan type, 2 Sa- guntum, 1 Saetabi) Celtic: 6 dr. (Rhoda type, monnaies Ã la croix) Rhodes: 1 tetradr. Roman Rep.: 12 den. Disposition: Cuenca (except Rhodes, Sae- tabi and 1 Carthage) Mateu y Llopis, Ampurias 1951, pp. 238-9, illus. Almagro Basch, NH 1958, pp. 5-14, illus.; 1960, pp. 213-4, illus. Almagro Basch-Almagro Gorbea, Numisma 71 (1964), pp. 25-47, illus. De Guadan, MPER, pp. 155-9 Crawford, RRCH 109 Allen, NC 1969, pp. 40, 62-3 Raddatz, Schatzfunde, pp. 266-7, illus. Villaronga, MHC (forthcoming)
